Context: The anhedonic effect of HFD was absent in leptin-deficient ob/ob mice although these animals gained more weight and adiposity in response to HFD than wild-type mice.
Cg-Lepob/J (ob/ob) mice and C57BL/6J wild-type (WT) mice obtained from Jackson Laboratory (Bar Harbor, ME, USA) through Charles River (Sulzfeld, Germany).

Effect of high-fat diet (HFD), relative to control diet (CD), in wild-type (WT) and ob/ob mice on caloric intake per cage (each cage housing 2 mice) (a), caloric intake per body weight (b), body weight (c), epididymal fat weight (d), behavior in the open field (OF) test (e,f), behavior in the elevated plus maze (EPM) test (g,h), behavior in the light-dark (L/D) box test (i,j), sucrose preference (k) and behavior in the splash test (l).
